abstract: Supreme Court Justice Anthony M Kennedy, considered to be crucial swing vote in deciding case on same-sex marriage, sends conflicting signals during arguments over gay marriage bans in Kentucky, Michigan, Ohio and Tennessee; first part of arguments focused on whether states should allow such marriages, and second part focused on whether states must recognized marriages performed in other states.
lead_paragraph: The justice believed to hold the controlling vote, Anthony M. Kennedy, appeared torn about what to do in a groundbreaking civil rights case.

headline.main: Gay Marriage Arguments Divide Supreme Court Justices
headline.print_headline: Divided Justices Spar Over Right to Gay Marriage

snippet: The justice believed to hold the controlling vote, Anthony M. Kennedy, appeared torn about what to do in a groundbreaking civil rights case.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
